html_lawbox:
377 U.S. 214 (1964)

MARKS
v.
ESPERDY, DISTRICT DIRECTOR, IMMIGRATION AND NATURALIZATION SERVICE.

No. 253.

Supreme Court of United States.

Argued April 2, 1964.
Decided May 18, 1964.
CERTIORARI TO THE UNITED STATES COURT OF APPEALS FOR THE SECOND CIRCUIT.

Murray A. Gordon argued the cause and filed briefs for petitioner.

Charles Gordon argued the cause for respondent. With him on the brief were Solicitor General Cox, Assistant Attorney General Miller and L. Paul Winings.

PER CURIAM.

The judgment is affirmed by an equally divided Court.

MR. JUSTICE BRENNAN took no part in the decision of this case.

html:
377 U.S. 214

84 S.Ct. 1224

12 L.Ed.2d 292

Herman Frederick MARKS, petitioner,
v.
P. A. ESPERDY, District Director, Immigration and Naturalization Service, New York District.

No. 253.—.

Supreme Court of the United States

October Term, 1963.

May 18, 1964

Rehearing Denied June 22, 1964.

See 84 S.Ct. 1904.

Murray A. Gordon, New York City, for petitioner.

Charles Gordon, Washington, D. C., for respondent.

On Writ of Certiorari to the United States Court of Appeals for the Second Circuit.

PER CURIAM.

1

The judgment is affirmed by an equally divided Court.

2

Mr. Justice BRENNAN took no part in the decision of this case.
